trigger_event: The city reels from BCI system prompts that appear to contain secret manipulations—trust is at a breaking point, and Nikola receives word of a dormant, high-level communication protocol he can still activate.
dilemma: Faced with a city teetering on the edge between chaos and new beginnings, Nikola must choose to either broadcast a single, bold citywide message that may force a reckoning, or deliberately block all attempts at mass communication, encouraging citizen action and community spontaneity instead.
reason: Nikola knows that either action will irrevocably shape how the city responds to its fractures, and fears both unleashing more division and allowing directionless unrest. His experience demands caution, but his conscience calls for resolution.
choice_a: Authorize a blunt citywide broadcast announcing the end of consensus, prompting every district to confront and redefine its own path forward.
belief_a: Genuine healing comes only by naming the rift, not hiding it.
Dialogue—even if fierce—is better than silence or false unity.
Legacy demands leaving a record, not erasing uncertainty.
choice_b: Suppress all citywide mass messaging, rerouting system privileges to let citizens fill the vacuum with festivals and subversive celebrations.
belief_b: Only unfettered, creative action brings people together when order fails.
Top-down appeals fuel cynicism and new myths.
Communal memory is built through living, not official failures.
